definition: to do harm to/to cause trouble to/harm/evil/calamity

sentences.english: Thee virus seems to have attacked his throat.
sentences.chinese: 病毒似乎已侵害到他的咽喉。

sentences.english: Frank consults his niece, Ann, about how to handle an insect invasion.
sentences.chinese: 弗兰克向他的侄女安请教如何对付昆虫的侵害。

sentences.english: Do not violate third-party intellectual property rights, including copyrights and trademarks.
sentences.chinese: 请勿侵害包括版权，商标在内的第三方知识产权。

sentences.english: Intact skin can protect the body from be invaded by germs.
sentences.chinese: 未受损的肌肤没去外国疑问保护肉体不受细菌侵害。

sentences.english: Seawater intake pipe-work systems always suffer the problems of fouling.
sentences.chinese: 海水管道系统经常饱受海洋生物污染的侵害。

sentences.english: Many cold- tolerant plants can be harmed by frost.
sentences.chinese: 许多耐寒植物会受到霜冻的侵害。

sentences.english: 268:The villagers were planting trees to protect the crops from the strong wind.
sentences.chinese: 为保护庄稼免受强风侵害，村民在植树。

sentences.english: Finally, legal responsibility for tort of portraiture right has been confirmed.
sentences.chinese: 最后，文章明确了侵害肖像权的法律责任。

sentences.english: The imported species damages the leaves of Platnus orientalit in Wuhan, Hubei Province.
sentences.chinese: 该种新人侵害虫在湖北武汉等城市危害三球悬铃木。
这种疾病侵害了谷类作物。

sentences.english: No words of mine could describe the pain and harm inflicted by such abuse.
sentences.chinese: 我无法用语言表达性侵害造成的痛苦和伤害。

sentences.english: ThreatenedAn oil boom guards a small island in the Gulf near the coastline.
sentences.chinese: 油栅保护海湾中靠近海岸线的小岛不受石油侵害。

sentences.english: Intact suce can protect the main part since be invaded by germs.
sentences.chinese: 未受损的皮肤能够保护身体不受细菌侵害。

sentences.english: According to the article, both government and bank sites had also been compromised.
sentences.chinese: 该文章称，连政府和银行的网站都受到了侵害。

sentences.english: Virtually, this is conduct of violating personal rights in the law area.
sentences.chinese: 质言之，乃是一种在范围内侵害个人权利的行为。

definition: to infringe on/to encroach on/to violate/to assault

pinyin: she4 hui4 gong1 gong4 li4 yi4

definition: to avoid suffering/to prevent (sth bad)/to protect against (damage)/immunity (from prosecution)/freedom (from pain, damage etc)/exempt from punishment
